Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class represents the board and is responsible for displaying all the GUI

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Constructor: This loads the inital board and direction buttons setting them up appropriatly It also creates the inital grid of empty dirt tiles

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor: This loads the inital board and direction buttons setting them up appropriatly It also creates the inital grid of empty dirt tiles
        Parameters:
        gameSquares - [] Array of buttons that represent the 4 x 4 grid of Tiles
        gameWindow - A JFrame which holds all of the layouts
        bLayout - A boarder layout which holds the directional buttons
        gLayout - A grid layout that holds the gameSquares[] buttons (Creating the game grid)
        emptyDirt - An instance of Picture that holds the empty dirt image

      • moveSquirrel

        public void moveSquirrel​(int moveAmount)
        Establishes which direction to move the squirrel in and calls moveSquirrel with appropriate squirel tiles and direction
        Parameters:
        moveAmount - The amount that the squirrel is to be moved (int)

      • validMove

        public boolean validMove​(int moveAmount,
                         Tile head,
                         Tile body,
                         Tile flower)
        Checks if the move is valid
        Parameters:
        moveAmount - The amount (int) that the squirrel is to be moved
        head - The Tile representing the head
        body - The Tile representing the body
        flower - The tile representing the flower (If the squirrel doesn't have a flower attached --> set to null)
        validSquirrel - Returns true if the move is valid
        clipping - Identifies if the squirrel attempts to clip through the walls of the grid onto the other side
        proposedPositionHead - Holds the proposed positon of the new head
        proposedPositionBot - Holds the proposed postion of the new body

      • moveSquirrel

        public void moveSquirrel​(int moveAmount,
                         Tile head,
                         Tile body,
                         Tile flower)
        Moves the squirrel to the correct location
        Parameters:
        moveAmount - The amount (int) that the squirrel is to be moved
        head - The Tile representing the head
        body - The Tile representing the body
        flower - The tile representing the flower (If the squirrel doesn't have a flower attached --> set to null)

      • checkForWin

        public boolean checkForWin​(int levels)
        Checks if the level has been completed
        Parameters:
        levels - The current level that the user is on
        win - Returns true if the level has been completed

      • changeButtonIcon

        public void changeButtonIcon​(int squareNumber,
                             Picture newIcon)
        Changes the icon on the grid to the new icon
        Parameters:
        squareNumber - The location of the square to be updated
        newIcon - The Picture icon of the new image
